title: rune type?
body:
---------- Forwarded message ----------
From: David Roundy <roundyd@physics.oregonstate.edu>
Date: Thu, Oct 14, 2010 at 07:36
Subject: Re: [go-nuts] Re: strings and code points and bytes...
To: rsc@golang.org
Cc: Stéphane Bortzmeyer <bortzmeyer@gmail.com>, Andrew Gerrand
<adg@golang.org>, Alexander Neumann <an2048@googlemail.com>, golang-nuts
<golang-nuts@googlegroups.com>


2010/10/13 Russ Cox <rsc@golang.org>:
....
> for a rare benefit.  Instead, Go makes it trivial to pay
> that cost if it makes sense - x := []int(s) - but it's not
> the default.

(Slightly off-topic...)

Is there any possibility of getting a "rune" primitive type defined? I
expect in not too many years we'll need to move int to 64-bit, since
it's hard-coded into the limit on the size of slices, and it'd be nice
for rune-manipulation code to not become bloated at that time.

David Roundy
